4D Scanning Transmission Electron Microscopy

This module contains a function called ‘stemarray4d’. ‘stemarray4d’ takes a 4D STEM array .raw file as an input. The function decomposes and processes this file into a more easily readable series of 2D .png image files. This function also generates a mean image and maximum image for the raw 4D array.

stemarray4d.stemarray4d(file_name, output_name)

‘stemarray4d’ is a function designed to take raw 4D STEM files and process them into more disgestable images.

Args:

This function has two inputs: ‘file_name’ and ‘output_name’. ‘file_name’ should be a 4D STEM .raw file. ‘output_name’ should be a string which will be the name of all outputs combined with the designator of the specific output.

Returns:

does not return anything. There are three primary outputs: a mean image, a max image, and a folder containing the decomposed 2D images of the 4D .raw image.

Exceptions:

will throw an exception if the input is not a file.
